Translation of 楚竹書・昔者君老(en) into English.

p.seg: The gentleman says:
“In the past, when the lord was old,
the heir to the throne would go to court to visit the lord,
and the maternal younger brother of the lord would assist (him) like this.
The heir to the throne would listen (=wait) at the side (of the entrance),
waiting (?) (for the order) to bow his head (=pay respect),
then he would bow his head and enter.
(Then) the heir to the throne would move to the front reaching the maternal younger brother,
the maternal younger brother would send him in and retreat.
The maternal younger brother would move to the front and reach the heir to the throne,
(inviting him to proceed) a second and a third time,
and only after that they would together listen to him (=the lord).
The heir to the throne and the maternal younger brother [...] would transmit the order at the lateral doors [...]
and announce it to the attendants,
the attendants would enter and announce (it) to the lord.
The lord would say:
“summon him”,
the heir to the throne would enter and see him,
as for the affair of ritual sacrifices [...]
[...] (you ministers should all be respectful) of your office,
you should all be reverent in your service,
in promulgating decrees you should not be remiss.
When the lord has (just) died,
the heir to the throne then does not hear (official news),
he does not listen (to official reports),
he does not enquire (about official news),
he does not order (new policies),
he only thinks about grief and sadness,
he is only careful about the great service of the state.
